item.title: The Joy of Making Something Your Friends Use
item.description:
I just had my first taste of making something people other than me actually use outside of work or school. It’s been really fun.

Problem

Some friends from middle/high school and I have an inside joke of sorts where we give each other points if one does something the other considers “foul.” Typically, it goes like this: someone does something the other doesn’t like, and the person who didn’t like it says “+1” (or 2, or however many points they feel). They then elicit support from other friends, and like that, foul sport points are assigned.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hi! I’m Mustafa, I’m a software engineer at HubSpot.

I graduated with a Bachelor of Computing (Honors) from Queen’s University in Canada. During my studies I TA’d for Discrete Mathematics and Introduction to CS. One summer I interned for CIBC, a bank.

Outside of work, I’m really into MMA and cooking.

item.title: I Used to Pray for What I Have Right Now
item.description:
Took me long enough :)

As of October 1st 2024 I work on the backend team of this product at HubSpot. Oh, I also moved to San Francisco. I live in a little studio in West SOMA.

How I Got the Job

One interesting note is I knew no one at the company. I didn’t send a LinkedIn message to a recruiter or anything. Complete cold apply.

The interview process was more or less like any other. Started in early August, 3 hour OA, 30 minute behevioural, 2 hour leetcode + sys design. I thought I bombed the OA. But then I got the recruiter call which I prepared for like hell. I killed it and got told I’d be moving to next steps within like 30 minutes of finishing the interview.
